p: Two oils from P. friedrichsthalianum leaves showed different chemical profiles: a Costa Rica specimen with caryophyllane, elemane, pinane, germacrane, and cadinane skeletons, represented by E-caryophyllene (36.8%), β-elemene (12.86%), α-pinene (10.6%), bicyclogermacrene (8.3%), β-pinene (8.3%), and α-ylangene (7.8%) [ 37]; and a Southeast Brazil specimen with the caryophyllane ( E-caryophyllene 24.6%, caryophyllene oxide 10.6%, and α-humulene 9.2%) and cadinane (α-5.9%) types [ 22].
